content.description:
Scramble over poor rock to a ledge. From here enjoy jugs up the face to some pockets up high. Really fun.



Found to the right of the second cave. 

15 Bolts

Climb choss for 2 bolts to gain a ramp/ledge, go to the right and climb another bolt of choss to get on to descent quality rock, one last bolt and you're on the belay ledge. No need to belay, the line is fairly plumb but you might want to extend/clean the first choss draw. 

Continue straight up from the rap rings (perma-draw right above) on good holds/big pockets. Clip up and then tech through a thin crux on pockets. Several meters of turbo-jugs brings you to a high crux that's more beta intensive than actually difficult (involves an under-cling that's so good you won't want to let go of it). Finally, a high nearly no-hands rest is available before you charge the super jugs comparable to the ones on "Bloodline" to the anchor. 



Starts on the first bolt line right of the first cave. Goes straight up from the anchors just left of the tree on the ledge, look for the perma. Look on the headwall for a fat grey streak and a thinner grey streak (~1 m wide) to the right; this line goes up the thinner grey streak. 

16 bolts, rap rings

Climb through the choss band on the chossiest choss to get to a ledge after the second bolt. Head up and right to the end of the ledge and climb up through the open book feature - a few more moves in choss get you to good rock - and onto a ledge with a pair of rap rings. Either belay here, or link the two pitches (~35 m).

From the rap rings, traverse left, passing a large abandoned nest in a hole and another belay station (bolt + rap ring; alternate belay option). Techy face climbing takes you up to a final hero move landing on a wrist-deep super-bucket. Pull up onto a no-hands ledge. 

Take a good rest, the "hero climbing" at the top is pumpy and not as straight forward as other climbs in the area!

Back clean as many draws as you can on the first pitch, extend the ones you leave, and back-clean/extend draws on the traverse. If you see the bolt line split, go left. 



This is the left-most route above the first cave (first route right of the first cave). Look for a prominent, fat grey streak on the headwall. Shares the start choss with "Blue-Blood" - left of the small tree on the ledge at 8 m. 

P2 only; 13 bolts, fixed anchor with a chain
Number of fun climbs, often you have to climb above some choss to get to the better rock above.
